main event: A cylindrical object was sighted at high altitude in Virginia and the Carolinas on multiple occasions between 1952 and 1956.
interesting points: One observer described the object as silvery-white and cylindrical, appearing at an altitude of 39,000 feet., The object was observed for durations ranging from 20 minutes to 35 minutes., Multiple military pilots, including Lt. Robert D. Anderson, confirmed sighting the object during their flights., The object displayed characteristics of high speeds and abrupt maneuvers., There was significant coordination and investigation by the USAF regarding these sightings.
witness description: military pilots and a reliable officer with the USAF
